summary: This document is an email chain dated August 11, 2019, concerning the planning of a suicide reconstruction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It involves coordination between a Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch coordinator and other staff regarding travel and attendance for the event.

persons.name: Deand
persons.context: Mentioned as traveling with the email author to the institution on Tuesday morning.

persons.name: illisill
persons.context: Appears to be a coordinator from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch, providing contact and cost center information for travel expenses.

connections.description: Both are involved in planning and traveling for the suicide reconstruction at MCC New York, indicating a professional working relationship.

events.title: Travel to institution for suicide reconstruction
events.description: Deand and the email author plan to travel to the institution (likely MCC New York) on Tuesday morning following the email date.

events.title: Upcoming suicide reconstruction at MCC New York
events.description: Planning is underway for a suicide reconstruction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, scheduled for the week of August 11, 2019.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
320 First Street, NW Washington DC 20534 (Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch)
keyFacts: A suicide reconstruction at MCC New York was being planned for the week of August 11, 2019.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch was coordinating staff travel and expenses for the event.
The email chain indicates procedural coordination following a death in custody, relevant to the Epstein case context.
